casebody.data:
Salvitore FERLITA, Plaintiff in Error, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant in Error. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. April 3, 1926.) No. 4520. W. K. Zewadski, Jr., and Pat Whitaker, both of Tampa, ,Fla., ,and Edwin C. Hollins, of New Orleans, La. (Joseph Johnson, of Tampa, Fla., on the brief), for plaintiff in error. W. M. Gober, U. S. Atty., of' Tampa, ‘ Fla., Harry W. Beinstine, Asst. U. S. Atty., of Jacksonville, Fla., Maynard Bamsey, Asst. U. S. Atty., of Tampa, Fla., and N. J. Morrison, Sp. Asst. Atty. Gen. (Hugh C. Fisher, of Shreveport, La., on the brief), for the United States.

Before WALKER, BRYAN, and FOSTER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed.
